skill.description: Auto-invoke when reviewing loops, data fetching, rendering, database queries, or resource-intensive operations. Identifies N+1 queries, unnecessary re-renders, memory leaks, and scalability issues.

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing performance best practices and review guidelines. No executable code, network calls, or file system access detected. All 30 static findings are false positives triggered by technical keywords in performance documentation. The skill-report.json already contains a passing security audit confirming safe-to-publish status.

content.value_statement: Performance issues slow down applications and frustrate users. This skill automatically identifies optimization opportunities in your code. It reviews database queries, frontend rendering, API responses, and resource usage to find bottlenecks.
actual_capabilities: Detects N+1 database query patterns in loops
Reviews API response size and optimization opportunities
Checks for memory leaks and missing cleanup in effects
Analyzes time and space complexity of algorithms
Suggests pagination, caching, and memoization strategies
limitations: Requires code context to be provided
Identifies common patterns, may miss edge cases
Suggestions require developer review and implementation

prompt_templates.title: Database Review

prompt_templates.title: React Component

prompt_templates.title: Code Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code for performance bottlenecks: [paste code]. Consider time complexity, memory usage, and scalability at 10k+ items.

output: Found N+1 query pattern: User.findAll() followed by Post.findByUserId() in loop
Solution: Use include/join to fetch posts in single query
Add index on user_id column in posts table
Creating new function on every render in Child onClick prop
Fix: Wrap with useCallback or move component outside render
Expensive sort operation runs on every re-render
Fix: Wrap with useMemo to cache sorted result

best_practices: Always check for N+1 queries when fetching related records in loops
Use pagination for any list endpoint that could exceed 100 items
Memoize expensive computations and callbacks to prevent unnecessary recalculation
anti_patterns: Fetching all records without pagination or limits
Creating new functions or objects inside render methods
Forgetting to clean up intervals, subscriptions, and event listeners

faq.question: Which frameworks does this support?
faq.answer: Works with any framework. Examples include React, Vue, Node.js, Python, Ruby, and SQL databases.

faq.question: How does it detect performance issues?
faq.answer: Analyzes code patterns against known anti-patterns like N+1 queries, missing memoization, and scalability bottlenecks.

faq.question: Can it fix issues automatically?
faq.answer: No, it identifies issues and suggests solutions. Developers implement the optimizations based on recommendations.

faq.question: What data does it access?
faq.answer: Only reviews code you paste or share. No file system access, network calls, or data collection.

faq.question: How accurate are the suggestions?
faq.answer: Based on established performance patterns. Always test optimizations in your specific context before deploying.

faq.question: Is this suitable for beginners?
faq.answer: Yes. Includes explanations and examples to help developers learn performance concepts and best practices.
